titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

action.text: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of Rule XI for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from Rules Committee on the same day it is presented to the House concerning any resolution reported on or before legislative day of November 23, 1995, providing for consideration or dispositon of: (1) H.R. 2491, any amendment thereto, any conference report theron, or any amendment reported in disagreement from a conference thereon. (2) Any bill making general appropriations for FY 96, any amendment thereto, or any amendment reported in disagreement from a conference thereon.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-352, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 130.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/17/1995--Introduced. Waives provisions of rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives that require a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to resolutions reported by such Committee on November 23, 1995, to provide for the consideration or disposition of H.R. 2491 (budget reconciliation) and any bill making general appropriations for FY 1996, including any amendment, conference report, or any amendment reported from conference in disagreement thereon.
